score.description:
You are more interested in keeping your money instead of growing it. While you may be satisfied with little returns on your investments, remember that this might make you more vulnerable to the impacts of inflation.

Get more in-depth investment advice based on your persona today!

You have a relaxed and stress-free approach with your investments. Financial security and wealth preservation are your top priorities so you tend to be more passive with building your portfolio. Be mindful not to let your investments go stagnant and at risk of loss due to inflation.

Get more in-depth investment advice based on your persona today!

You are largely influenced by your peers when it comes to investment decisions. Without much personal thought and input into your portfolio, you may not be aware of your true financial potential and how to achieve it.

Get more in-depth investment advice based on your persona today!

You have a hands-on approach your investments. You listen to your instincts and closely manage your portfolio.Take note to regularly evaluate your risk levels and stay focused on your long-term goals!

Get more in-depth investment advice based on your persona today!

You take an active approach to building your portfolio and accumulating wealth. You’re an early adopter, willing to explore every new investment opportunity. Try not to let your adventurous spirit get the best of you by regularly evaluating your risk and horizon profile.

Get more in-depth investment advice based on your persona today!

question.question: How would your friends describe you?

answers.value: Grounded and stable - I’m definitely the least problematic in our group!
I’m their go-to friend - they know I’m always there for them!
I have tried every bubble tea in Singapore!
Interesting - always up to date with the latest news and events!
Ambitious and determined - I have to-do lists to achieve all my goals!

question.question: When you travel, how do you plan your holidays?

answers.value: What holiday? I’d rather buy something tangible or save that money.
Staycations only! No planning. No hassles. And it’s easy on the budget.
Me, planning? I leave all that with my travel buddies or have the travel agency do all the planning!
I research places that interest me - I don’t mind going on my own if others don’t want to!
Traveling is about new experiences, so all my trips must include a new experience.

question.question: Time for a beach holiday with friends! How are you spending it?

answers.value: I’m making the most of my hotel room! Getting a tan would be disastrous as I have nothing in my wardrobe that suits a tan.
I’m staying on the beach, reading a book, and ordering my favourite piña colada.
See where my friends go and just tag along wherever!
I’ve got my itinerary all planned out. See you later!
Wow, I’ve never tried Jet Blading! C’mon everybody follow me!

question.question: You go to a café, and see a new flavour on the menu: Mala Coffee. Your usual is still on the menu. What will you order?

answers.value: Just my usual Long Black coffee - what else? Better safe than sorry!
The usual - but do I want it hot or cold? Should I get cake? Maybe not…
Whatever I feel like at the moment - but I’ll get my friend to try out the new flavour!
Obviously the Mala Coffee! New is always more interesting.
One sec. Let me check the reviews on social media.

question.question: It’s Friday night, it’s your turn to pick a dinner place with your friends!

answers.value: Cozy at-home dinner - we can do pot luck or get takeaways!
Everybody loved the last restaurant we went to - so let’s go there again!
Ask my colleagues for recommendations - they’ll know better than Google!
I already booked the new restaurant in town – it’s one in my wishlist of restaurants we need to try!
Ever tried dining in the dark or molecular cuisines? I’ll make the reservations.

question.question: What’s your ideal mode of transport?

answers.value: Walking or biking if it’s very near, buses or trains if it’s a distance away.
Buses and trains - they’re so reliable!
Everybody takes Grab these days!
It depends on what makes sense at the time - I don’t mind walking, public transport, or Grab.
A car is so much more efficient to get around!

question.question: Oh no! Your phone shattered on the sidewalk. Time to buy a new one. Which sounds most like you?

answers.value: Checking with my family who has an extra phone while I research the best phone in the market.
I’ll just get the exact same one - no stress!
There’s this new model that everybody wants - so I want it too!
I need to do more research - but definitely not going for the obvious choices.
Last year's model is cheaper and I can get a $100 credit for my broken phone. Sold.

question.question: Your boss just gave you the day off (paid!). How will you spend it?

answers.value: At home - catching up on all my Netflix and Youtube shows.
Resetting. Yoga and a walk in the park should do the trick.
Meeting up with my friends - different ones for breakfast, lunch, and dinner!
Attending an event, visiting that exhibit I always wanted to, and just enjoying me-time.
I’ve got quite a lot of errands - so I need to check them off my list!

question.question: When it comes to investing money, which of these are you most likely to do?

answers.value: Investing? I don’t know… I’m quite happy growing my savings account.
Keep my money in low-risk asset with slow but steady growth.
Take the advice of my friends or see what investment strategies are trending…
Do a lot of research, cross-reference sources, and create a solid plan for my own needs.
Research and buy undervalued investments that has great potential in the future that no one else is talking about yet.

question.question: How quickly do you want to see results from your investments?

answers.value: It depends on how my plan plays out - I should be covered either way.
I would only put a small amount in secure funds, so perhaps 1-3 years?
I’m not sure - my friends have all had different results!
It depends on how my plan plays out - I should be covered either way.
It doesn’t matter much - I’m in this for the long term!

question.question: What are your current financial concerns?

answers.value: Concerned about not able to meet future financial / retirement needs due to inflation
Overspending and can’t seem to get out of debt
Never have to worry about money…what do you think?

question.question: What is your own perceived risk profile?

answers.value: Very conservative
Conservative
Neutral
Aggressive
Very aggressive
